alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Kerr; Real (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 8:37PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bandera, Kerr and Real. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 836 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over the past 3 hours. Portions of the advisory area also had up to 5 to 6 inches of rain this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Medina, Kerrville, Bandera, Vanderpool, Tarpley, Ingram, Hunt, Waltonia, Lost Maples State Natural Area, Kerr Wildlife Management Area, Kerrville-Schreiner Park, Mountain Home and Hill Country State Natural Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
